Award.AbstractNarration:
A request is made to fund Shipboard Scientific Support Equipment on the R/V Marcus Langseth, a 235? Global seismic vessel with general oceanographic capabilities. The vessel is owned by NSF and operated by Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory of Columbia University under a cooperative agreement. The Langseth is different than other vessels in the Academic Fleet in that it is a designated National Facility. It provides a unique combination of capabilities for imaging the oceans, the seafloor and the solid earth beneath the sea. It is the only vessel in the word dedicated to academic research that is capable of conducting 3D seismic surveys as well as extended offset 2D surveys. The tuned, linear source array, consisting of up to 36 air-guns, with a total capacity of 6,600 cu in is also unique asset of this vessel.

In 2015, R/V Langseth completed 194 days, 130 (67%) of which were NSF funded. In 2016, the schedule shows 165 days, all of which are for NSF. SSSE requested in this proposal includes:

Furuno Doppler Speed Log FS-80 $15,945
Engineering Support for upgrade of the Wet Lab $46,895
Engineering support Water Closet on navigating bridge $35,205
Overhaul and upgrade of Dynacon Traction Winch $372,200
$470,245

Broader Impacts
The principal impact of the present proposal is under Merit Review Criterion 2 of the Proposal Guidelines (NSF 13-589). It provides infrastructure support for scientists to use the vessel and its shared-use instrumentation in support of their NSF-funded oceanographic research projects (which individually undergo separate review by the relevant research program of NSF). The acquisition, maintenance and operation of shared-use instrumentation allows NSF-funded researchers from any US university or lab access to working, calibrated instruments for their research, reducing the cost of that research, and expanding the base of potential researchers.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 2016 Shipboard Scientific Support Equipment award funded the acquisition of a new doppler Speed Log unit to replace a failed unit (Furuno DS 50) on the bridge of the R/V Marcus Langseth. The Speed Log is used to accurately measure speed and distance for a ship at sea. Ths speed and distance information is used by other radar and navigation equipment on the bridge of the vessel as well.   The existing unit could not be repaired as this model is no longer supported by the manufacturer and parts are no longer available. 

The award allowed for the purchase of a new and upgraded Furuno DS 80 Speed Log that improves provides improved accuracy and compatibilty with other equipment.  Upgrading to the DS 80 required replacing existing transducers and equipment that resides in a gondola that is attached to bottom of the vessel's hull. This can only be done during dry dock of of the vessel. We took advantage of a regular required dry docking during shipyard in September 2016 to replace the equipment in gondola and bridge. The new Speed Log was commissioned in dry dock and then tested during a harbor trial conducted at  completion of the shipyard period.
